skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection package

skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.engine module

This module provides the Engine class, which is responsible for managing database connections. The Engine class handles opening and closing connections to the database, ensuring that only one connection is open at any time.

class skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.engine.Engine[source]

Bases: object

Manages database connections, including opening and closing them.

_config

An object of class Config or its subclasses, representing the configuration of the database.

Type:

Config

_connection

Stores the opened connection to the database.

Type:

Connection|None

_is_connected

Indicates whether a connection is already open (True) or has not been opened yet (False).

Type:

bool

_adapter

Adapter for the database specified in the configuration.

Type:

Adapter

close() → None[source]

Closes the connection to the database if one is open.

property config

Returns the configuration of the database.

Returns:

The configuration object.

Return type:

Config

connect() → object[source]

Opens a connection to the database if it hasn’t been opened yet.

Returns:

The opened connection to the database.

Return type:

Connection

property connected: bool

Indicates whether a connection is currently open.

Returns:

True if a connection is open, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.session module

Module provides Session class, that handels executing orm operations like inserting to database, selecting from database, etc.

class skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.session.Session(engine: Engine)[source]

Bases: object

Session is context manager and executes CRUD operations or selects on objects of our models

_engine

An object of class Engine that opens and stores connection to the database.

Type:

Engine

_connection

Stores opened connection to the database.

Type:

Connection|None

_new

A list of model instances to be inserted into the database.

Type:

list[Model]

_dirty

A list of model instances with pending updates in the database.

Type:

list[Model]

_delete

A list of model instances to be deleted from the database.

Type:

list[Model]

_map

An instance of IdentityMap to keep track of model instances and prevent duplicates.

Type:

IdentityMap

add(obj: Model)[source]

Adds a model instance to the session and database. INSERT isn’t executed right away (lazy execution concept)

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model instance to add.

changed(obj: Model)[source]

Marks a model instance as changed in the session. UPDATE isn’t executed right away (lazy execution concept)

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model instance that has changed.

close()[source]

Ends session. Releases database connection to engine. Rolls back any uncommited changes, user needs to commit changes before closing session or they will be lost.

commit()[source]

Commits any changes made to the database.

Execute any pending operations that were stored in the given session (lazy execution).

property connection

Return stored connection to database

delete(obj: Model)[source]

Deletes a model instance from the session and database. DELETE isn’t executed right away (lazy execution concept)

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model instance to delete.

Raises:

ValueError – if given object isn’t part of a session (hasn’t been added)

flush()[source]

Flushes any pending changes in the session to the database. If object has foreign key, adjusts insert order.

get(model: Type[Model], primary_key: Any)[source]

Retrieves a model instance from the database based on the provided primary key.

Parameters:

  • model (Type[Model]) – The model class representing the type of object to retrieve.

  • primary_key (Any) – The primary key value of the object to retrieve.

Returns:

The retrieved model instance from the database.

Return type:

Model

rollback()[source]

Rolls back changes in current transaction in database

select(statement: Select)[source]

Executes a select query and returns the results. Before execution flushes any pending changes to database.

Parameters:

statement (Select) – The select query statement.

Returns:

A list of model instances or result objects retrieved from the database.

Return type:

list[Model | Result]

skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.identity module

This module provides the IdentityMap class, which is responsible for managing a collection of model instances to ensure that only one instance of each object exists within the application context.

class skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.identity.IdentityMap[source]

Bases: object

Manages a collection of model instances to ensure that only one instance of each object exists within the application context.

_dict

A dictionary storing model instances, keyed by a tuple of model name and primary key.

Type:

dict[tuple[str, Any], Model | None]

add(obj: Model) → bool[source]

Adds a model instance to the identity map.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model instance to add.

Returns:

True if the model instance was added, False if it was already present.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

Exception – If a different instance with the same key is already present.

get(key: tuple[str, Any], default: Model | None = None) → Model | None[source]

Retrieves the model instance associated with the given key, or returns the default value if not found.

Parameters:

  • key (tuple[str, Any]) – The key to retrieve the model instance.

  • default (Optional[Model]) – The default value to return if the key is not found. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The model instance associated with the given key, or the default value if not found.

Return type:

Optional[Model]

remove(obj: Model) → None[source]

Removes the given model instance from the identity map.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model instance to remove.

Represents a result from a query to a database.

skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.transaction module

The transaction module provides the Transaction class, which manages database transactions for executing multiple database operations atomically.

class skibidi_orm.query_engine.connection.transaction.Transaction(compiler: SQLCompiler, connection: Any)[source]

Bases: object

Manages a transaction for executing multiple database operations.

_compiler

The SQL compiler used to generate SQL statements.

Type:

SQLCompiler

_conn

The connection object to the database.

Type:

Any

_insert

A list of Insert statements to be executed.

Type:

list[Insert]

_update

A list of Update statements to be executed.

Type:

list[Update]

_delete

A list of Delete statements to be executed.

Type:

list[Delete]

property delete_list

Returns the list of Delete statements in the transaction.

Returns:

A list of Delete statements.

Return type:

list[Delete]

execute()[source]

Executes all registered Insert, Update, and Delete statements in the transaction.

execute_delete(statement: Delete)[source]

Executes the given Delete statement.

Parameters:

statement (Delete) – The Delete statement to execute.

execute_insert(statement: Insert)[source]

Executes the given Insert statement.

Parameters:

statement (Insert) – The Insert statement to execute.

execute_update(statement: Update)[source]

Executes the given Update statement.

Parameters:

statement (Update) – The Update statement to execute.

property insert_list

Returns the list of Insert statements in the transaction.

Returns:

A list of Insert statements.

Return type:

list[Insert]

register_delete(obj: Model)[source]

Registers a Delete statement for the given model object.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model object for which to register a Delete statement.

register_insert(obj: Model)[source]

Registers an Insert statement for the given model object.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model object for which to register an Insert statement.

register_update(obj: Model)[source]

Registers an Update statement for the given model object.

Parameters:

obj (Model) – The model object for which to register an Update statement.

property update_list

Returns the list of Update statements in the transaction.

Returns:

A list of Update statements.

Return type:
